ygData.subject: Re: Amulet of Order
ygData.msgSnippet: ... Well, I checked with the oasis gypsies and the shady Swashbuckler, and the both consider me indifferently. As I stated before I have a CHA of 93, and my
ygData.messageBody:
>From: John Kim <kim@...>
>Reply-To: eqbards@onelist.com
>To: eqbards@onelist.com
>Subject: Re: [eqbards] Amulet of Order
>Date: Mon, 24 May 1999 18:22:52 -0400 (EDT)
>
>From: John Kim <kim@...>
>
>On Mon, 24 May 1999, jay schultze wrote:
> > >From: Proteus <pr0teus@...>
> > >
> > >I also bought my combine longsword for 52.5pp and my charisma is 90.
> >
> > I just went to the Oasis gypsies yesterday on Veeshan with my 95
>charisma
> > and was quoted 54.8 plat.
>
>Obviously there's more going on here. Can you answer the
>following:
>
>What is your race and diety?
>
>How did the gypsies view you (amiable? indifferent?)
>
>What is the selling price you're offered for the combine
>longsword at your guild merchant? (47.5pp here)
>
>Can you check the price for a well-balanced longsword on the
>shady swashbuckler between North Ro and Easy Commonlands? I
>get 223pp plus change.
>
> > > Hmm interesting. You must be wood elf i'm guessing then.
> > > The gypsies were indifferent (or amiable) to me. I'm human.
>
>The Oasis gypsies are indifferent to me as well. My bard is a
>wood elf, diety is Erollisi Marr. (DON'T LAUGH! I figured
>it'd be nice to be friendly with the paladin guilds and the
>diety description says many paladins follow Erollisi, so I
>picked it. Now that I've played the game some, the only
>followers of Erollisi I've found are the Sisters of Erollisi
>in the Ocean of Tears. :-)

Well, I checked with the oasis gypsies and the shady Swashbuckler, and the
both consider me indifferently. As I stated before I have a CHA of 93, and
my deity is Quellious the Tranquil. The gypsies will sell me a combine long
sword for about 54.7 plat. The other day the Shady Swashbuckler was asking
231 plat for a well-balanced long-sword. Last night he was asking 238.


>I've noticed the sisters of Erollisi "kindly consider me"
>instead of considering me amiably or indifferently. Is this
>what other people are seeing from NPCs with the same diety?
>

I'm pretty sure this is the case. My high elf wizard of Tunare was kindly
considered by most of the denizens of Felwithe (especially the Paladin
guildmasters).

Sartori D'Elsiraad
Bard of Kelethin of the 11th Chorus
Veeshan
